citation.article-title: Echinicola jeungdonensis sp. nov., isolated from a solar saltern
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Echinicola jeungdonensis sp. nov.
Echinicola jeungdonensis (jeung.do.nen′sis. N.L. fem. adj. jeungdonensis of island Jeungdo, Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile and aerobic rods (0.7–0.8 µm wide and 1.4–1.5 µm long).
Colonies on MA are convex, circular, smooth and yellow–orange with entire margins, approximately 1 mm in diameter after 3 days at 25 °C.
No growth occurs on TSA, nutrient agar, blood agar, MacConkey agar, DNase test agar or skim milk.
Growth occurs with 1–15 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 2 % NaCl), at pH 6–9 (optimum pH 7) and at 15–42 °C (optimum 20 °C).
Positive for oxidase, catalase, nitrate reduction and aesculin hydrolysis, but negative for indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease and gelatinase.

With API ZYM, alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α- and β-galactosidases, α- and β-glucosidases and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are present, but esterase (C4), lipase (C14), α-chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are absent.

With GN2 MicroPlates, utilizes as sole carbon sources α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, α-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-psicose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, acetic acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucuronic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, dl-lactic acid, succinamic acid, glucuronamide, l-alaninamide, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-proline, uridine and α-d-glucose 1-phosphate, but does not utilize Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, d-arabitol, i-erythritol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, xylitol, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-gluconic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, α-, β- and γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, d-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, d-alanine, l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine, l-pyroglutamic acid, d- and l-serine, l-threonine, dl-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol, dl-α-glycerol phosphate or d-glucose 6-phosphate.

The major fatty acids (>5 %) are iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, summed feature 3 (comprising C16 : 1ω6c and/or C16 : 1ω7c) and summed feature 9 (comprising iso-C17 : 1ω9c and/or 10-methyl C16 : 0).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46.9 mol%.
The type strain, HMD3054T ( = KCTC 23122T = CECT 7682T), was isolated from a solar saltern in Jeungdo, Sinan, Jeolnam, Republic of Korea.
